channel.title: Comments on: Balsamiq Mockups – Turn Any Computer Into a Napkin
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Michal
item.dc:creator: Michal
item.content:encoded:
Great post, I love Balsamiq! Use it every week.
Before I use Balsamiq though, I like using MockUpMagnets.com.
Great for client meetings, UI brainstorming, etc.

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.content:encoded:
Nice. I usually just sketch it out on a piece of paper, too.

As for Comic Sans, its developer said, “If you love it, you don’t know much about typography. But, if you hate it, you really don’t know much about typography, either, and you should get another hobby.”

http://forum.lessthandot.com/viewtopic.php?f=101&t=5521&start=0&st=0&sk=t&sd=a&hilit=comic+sans

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.content:encoded:
Peldi – I guess I should have RTFM before I wrote about it (I probably would have if it bothered me, but I like it as is ðŸ™‚ ). Thanks for the link to the FAQ though – it doesn’t seem like it would be too hard to change at all, and a much better alternative than using the system font!

I took a look at the chalkboard font, and it looks pretty good to me (not that much different from Comic Sans to be honest – but I guess that is why I am not a font designer!) I like that you’re shooting for a hand written font that’s a little rough around the edges, as that style really fits the feel of the mockups well.

tperri – I’ll be starting a Comic Sans support group soon, your invitation is in the mail ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Peldi Guilizzoni
item.dc:creator: Peldi Guilizzoni
item.content:encoded:
Hello Alex, thanks so much for the great review!

On OSX we no longer use Comis Sans as default, but for those who are on Windows/Linux and want to change font, we have a FAQ for you: http://www.balsamiq.com/products/mockups/support#comicsans

Thanks again for taking the time to write this up, we appreciate it!

item.title: By: tperri
item.dc:creator: tperri
item.description: I use Balsamiq, too, and I love it. Even the Comic Sans :)
item.content:encoded: I use Balsamiq, too, and I love it. Even the Comic Sans ðŸ™‚
